page.title: 06Daventry's Industries 1985
page.content: Almost 180 companies registered themselves on a list of Daventry's companies compiled by the Council Estates Dept. this year. The vast majority of these occupy units on the two big industrial estates- Long March and Royal Oak. The few others occupy individual sites around the town. Most companies in Daventry have been established here in the last 20 years (many in the last 5), but a few have been here longer e.g. White & Co (still involved in the "traditional" footwear industry), the BBC, and British Timken. The newer companies are very varied both in size and business. Three of the biggest employers in the town (with hundreds on each payrole) are:- Ford Motor Co, a massive distributor & training cetre for the car company; Cummins, who make & export diesel engines all over the world; (cont 7)
